intro: Stachys stenophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf betony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, forming showy spikes of blue to violet blooms. Stachys stenophylla is often found in grassy woodlands and moist meadows, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
